remarks: A lift of a continuous function from a connected and locally connected space over a covering map is unique when it exists.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Mar-2015.)  (Revised by NM, 17-Jun-2017.)
statement:
cvmliftmo.b $e |- B = U. C $.
cvmliftmo.y $e |- Y = U. K $.
cvmliftmo.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( C CovMap J ) ) $.
cvmliftmo.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. Con ) $.
cvmliftmo.l $e |- ( ph -> K e. N-Locally Con ) $.
cvmliftmo.o $e |- ( ph -> O e. Y ) $.
cvmliftmo.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. ( K Cn J ) ) $.
cvmliftmo.p $e |- ( ph -> P e. B ) $.
cvmliftmo.e $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` P ) = ( G ` O ) ) $.
cvmliftmo $p |- ( ph -> E* f e. ( K Cn C ) ( ( F o. f ) = G /\ ( f ` O ) = P ) ) $.
$d C f $.
$d F f $.
$d G f $.
$d K f $.
